Welcome to DotsNLines! The goal of the game is to score more points than your opponent by "closing" more squares.
\n\nPlease swipe through the pages for more instructions on how to play!

To begin your move, tap any of the grey dots. It will then turn green to indicate the first "end-point" for your move. Then, select a grey dot directly adjacent to the green one (directly above, below, to the left or to the right).
\n\nTap the green dot again to cancel that move.

To score a point, you must "close" a 1X1 square. A dot of your color will then appear to indicate that the square has been awarded to you as a point and the meter at the bottom of the board will update to reflect the score difference.
\n\nPlease note that once a score is awarded, that 1X1 square can no longer be used to earn points.

Once you score a point, you earn an extra move and can continue making moves until you do not earn a point.
\n\nPlease note that though you may be able find an opportunity to earn 2 points on one move (two adjacent 1X1 squares), this will still only earn you ONE extra move.
Plan ahead and play strategically! The larger the board, the more opportunities to score (or to help your opponent find a streak!)

The game ends when all possible moves have been exhausted.


Depending on the size of the board, a tie may be possible, however in most cases, the game will end with one player having more points than the other. The player with the most points wins!


And most importantly, ENJOY!
